data.title: Tautomeric forms of oxy- and oxo-derivatives of 1-3-5-triazine. Part II. The ultraviolet absortion of 2-4-6-trimethoxy-l-3-5-triazine and 2-4-6-trioxo-1-3-5-trimethyl-hexahydro-triazine
data.meta_description: The spectra of the two tautomeric isomers V and VI have been studied in the range 200-350 mμ, using n-hexane, dioxane, acetonitrile and water as solvents. Both molecules possess a shoulder at about 45,000 cm <SUP>-1</SUP> which is assigned to a n → π* transition. The recorded spectra give evidence for a strong absorption band slightly above 50,000 cm <SUP>-l</SUP>, which should be assigned to a π → π* transition. These results are regarded as an indication that the lowest energy levels of the two tautomeric forms have a rather similar pattern, the main difference being in their transition moments, and, hence, in the intensity of the corresponding bands.
data.text:
Abstract

The spectra of the two tautomeric isomers V and VI have been studied in the range 200-350 mμ, using n-hexane, dioxane, acetonitrile and water as solvents. Both molecules possess a shoulder at about 45,000 cm -1 which is assigned to a n → π* transition. The recorded spectra give evidence for a strong absorption band slightly above 50,000 cm -l, which should be assigned to a π → π* transition. These results are regarded as an indication that the lowest energy levels of the two tautomeric forms have a rather similar pattern, the main difference being in their transition moments, and, hence, in the intensity of the corresponding bands.
